software.leonov.cells.util

Class StyleBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.leonov.cells.util.StyleBuilder

  • public final class StyleBuilder
extends Object
    A builder for creating CellStyles.

    Example: 

       import static org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.IndexedColors.*;
   import static org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.CellStyle.*;

   // Creating a new style

   final StyleBuilder builder = new StyleBuilder()
                         .setWrapText(true)
                         .setBorder(BorderStyle.DASH_DOT);

   final CellStyle wrappedDashDotStyle = builder.create(workbook);

   final CellStyle wrappedBorderThinStyle = builder
                        .setBorder(BorderStyle.BORDER_THIN)
                        .create(workbook);
                        
   // Update an existing style
   
   CellStyle style = workbook.createCellStyle();
   ...
   new StyleBuilder().setWrapText(false).update(style);
    Builder instances are reusable. It maintains its own state and can create or update multiple CellStyle instances across different workbooks.

    Note: A workbook can store a finite number of cell-styles. Be careful not to create identical instances. Styles should be reused whenever possible.

    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StyleBuilder()
      Creates a new StyleBuilder with no default settings.

      • setRotation

        public StyleBuilder setRotation(short rotation)
        Sets the degree of rotation for the text in the cell.

        Note: Rotation ranges can be set in values of -90 and 90 degrees or 0 and 180 degrees, depending on the underlying cell-style appropriate conversion will be performed.

        Parameters:
        rotation - degrees (between -90 and 90 degrees) or (between 0 and 180 degrees)
        Returns:
        this StyleBuilder instance

        public StyleBuilder setWrapText(boolean wrapped)

        this StyleBuilder instance
